From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To enable use of the **lock** EXEC command, use the **lockable** command in line configuration mode. To reinstate the default (the terminal session cannot be locked), use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: In the following example, the terminal connection is configured as lockable, then the current connection is locked:
ExtraInfo: This command enables use of temporary terminal locking, which is executed using the **lock** EXEC command. Terminal locking allows a user keep the current session open while preventing access by other users.

RelatedCmds.description: Prevents access to your session by other users by setting a temporary password on your terminal line.
